title: Pokémon: The Johto Journeys
description: Take one more step up the ladder by joining Ash in the Johto region in Pokémon: The Johto Journeys, now on Pokémon TV!

title: Pokémon: Johto League Champions
description: Ash and Pikachu explore the Johto region in the fourth season of Pokémon the Series. Watch it now on Pokémon TV!

title: Pokémon: Master Quest
description: Ash’s Johto journey reaches its conclusion at the Johto League Silver Conference in Pokémon: Master Quest, now on Pokémon TV!

media.title: Around the Whirlpool
media.description: In a scuffle with Team Rocket, Ash and friends are thrown from the ship bearing them to the Whirl Islands.

media.title: Fly Me to the Moon
media.description: Our heroes discover an island on which the Pidgey population—long protected by environmental regulation and free from predators—has grown to unusually stout proportions and virtually abandoned any desire for flight.

media.title: Takin' it on the Chinchou
media.description: On their way to the Whirl Cup competition, Ash and friends are fortunate enough to pass a small mountain village just as an annual Chinchou migration is about to occur.

media.title: A Corsola Caper
media.description: Just as Ash and friends arrive at a new island, their ears are met with cries for help.

media.title: Mantine Overboard
media.description: Our heroes narrowly miss the ferry to Redrock Isle, but are fortunate enough to bump into a Pokémon researcher and a deep-sea diver who offers to carry them across the strait in her boat.

media.title: Octillery the Outcast
media.description: After reaching the town where the preliminary round of the Whirl Cup is held, Ash and Misty enter and earn the two victories required to continue on to the finals.

media.title: Dueling Heroes
media.description: As the final round of the Whirl Cup begins, Ash and Misty must each face formidable opponents.

media.title: The Perfect Match
media.description: Ash and Misty each emerge victorious from arduous bouts only to be paired against one another in the next round.

media.title: Plant It Now... Diglett Later
media.description: A village of kind, elderly people prepares a great meal for Ash and friends, and in return requests that the Pokémon Trainers assist them in defending their village against a gang of marauders.

media.title: Hi Ho Silver... Away
media.description: Ash, Misty, and Brock run into a local shopkeeper who introduces them to one of her friends, a jewelry maker who tells them the legend of the fourth Whirl Island.

media.title: The Mystery is History
media.description: While on their quest to locate a mysterious Pokemon, Ash, Misty, and Brock run into their old friends Richie, and his Pikachu, Sparky.

media.title: A Parent Trapped
media.description: With the young Lugia in the possession of Butch and Cassidy, Ash and friends set about rescuing it while protecting its parent from itself.

media.title: A Promise Is a Promise
media.description: Ash and friends do their best to free the captured Lugia from Team Rocket.

media.title: Throwing in the Noctowl!
media.description: Ash and the others set off for the last boat out to Olivine City, but they wind up missing it!

media.title: Nerves of Steelix!
media.description: As Ash prepares for his Olivine Gym battle, he and the others come across a giant Wobbuffet. It's Team Rocket's Wobbu Warrior, and they're trying to capture Pikachu!

media.title: Bulbasaur...the Ambassador
media.description: When the Pokémon at Professor Oak's lab in Kanto have a hard time getting along, the professor asks Ash to send his Bulbasaur to the lab so it can help keep the peace.

media.title: Espeon, Not Included
media.description: Our heroes meet up with an old friend, Sakura, and her Pokemon—an Espeon that evolved from her Eevee.

media.title: For Ho-Oh the Bells Toll
media.description: When Ash, Misty, and Brock run to investigate a mysterious chorus of bells that spontaneously ring out, they chance to meet their old friend Morty and a Pokémon researcher of his acquaintance.

media.title: Extreme Pokémon
media.description: On their way to Mahogany City, Ash, Misty, and Brock run into Gary and his Arcanine practicing for a meet.

media.title: An Egg-Sighting Adventure
media.description: The egg—yet to hatch—that Ash had received from a grateful Pokemon breeder turns up missing.

media.title: Hatching a Plan
media.description: At long last Ash's egg hatches, a Phanpy emerging to finally put everyone's curiosity to rest. Ash and friends' excitement is matched only by that of Jessie and James of Team Rocket.

media.title: Dues and Don'ts
media.description: As Jessie, James, and Meowth track Ash and friends, they commiserate over past failures and discuss how they are paired unfairly against these younger trainers with such a superior array of Pokémon.

media.title: Just Waiting on a Friend
media.description: Our heroes are traveling over a mountain pass when inclement weather occasions a stay in a lodge located conveniently nearby.

media.title: Fit to be Tyrogued
media.description: Ash and friends chance into a Tyrogue, nearly falling victim to a ploy it lays out in an attempt to make off with all of their Pokémon food.

media.title: Xatu the Future
media.description: Ash and friends meet a Xatu, a Pokémon said to have the ability to see into the future.

media.title: Talkin' 'bout an Evolution
media.description: Ash and friends discover a red Gyarados, unknowingly uncovering a plot by Team Rocket to control the secrets of Pokémon evolution.

media.title: The Rage of Innocence
media.description: Before they can oppose Team Rocket's evil plan to gain control of the Pokémon of the world, Ash and friends must escape from a Team Rocket holding pen.

media.title: As Cold as Pryce
media.description: Finally setting foot in Mahogany Town, Ash is anxious to set about winning his next badge.

media.title: Nice Pryce, Baby
media.description: Having earned Pryce's respect and permission to face the trainer in a gym battle, Ash makes the unlikely choice of sending out Cyndaquil, a Fire Pokémon, to face his opponent on an Ice battlefield.

media.title: Whichever Way the Wind Blows
media.description: Hardly taking a second to relish his latest gym victory, Ash quickly sets course for the next gym in Blackthorn City.

media.title: Some Like It Hot
media.description: Ash, Misty, and Brock face many roadblocks on the path to success, some metaphoric and others in the form of gigantic Magcargo that refuse to step aside and let a traveler pass.

media.title: Hocus Pokémon
media.description: Brock rarely meets a girl whom he doesn't find bewitching, but on encountering a particular young woman, even Ash and Misty can't deny that there is something magical about her.

media.title: As Clear as Crystal
media.description: When a tangle with Team Rocket leaves Pikachu desperately exhausted, a young passerby offers to restore Pikachu's energy.

media.title: Same Old Song and Dance
media.description: In the midst of their travels, Ash and friends meet up with a young girl who, along with her two Igglybuff assistants, stars in her own musical variety television program.

media.title: Enlighten Up
media.description: As Ash and friends approach the site where Ash will earn his eighth badge, they fall victim to an unexpected Team Rocket trap.

media.title: Will the Real Oak Please Stand Up?
media.description: Hearing of the posh reception prepared for the host and guest of a radio show to be recorded before a live audience, Jessie and James of Team Rocket quickly announce that they are in fact the long-awaited celebrities.

media.title: Wish Upon a Star Shape
media.description: Ash, Misty, and Brock are traveling along when they notice a strange shape falling from the sky. They run in to investigate, but soon realized that they were not the only witnesses of this event.

media.title: Outrageous Fortunes
media.description: On meeting up with a proud Pokémon trainer who dares all comers to face his Poliwrath, Misty and Ash quickly rise to the challenge.

media.title: One Trick Phony
media.description: Seeing that Ash just can't get enough battling, a trainer who loses to him suggests as she leaves that he give a local Pokémon battle park a try.

media.title: I Politoed Ya So
media.description: When Ash, Misty, and Brock pause for a quaint picnic by a lake, Politoed wanders off and is mistaken by another trainer for her own Politoed, the rhythm leader in her Pokémon cheerleading squad that had gone AWOL.

media.title: Beauty is Skin Deep
media.description: Finally reaching the outskirts of Blackthorn City, Ash pushes to quickly seek out the gym where he hopes to earn his final Johto badge.

media.title: Fangs For Nothing
media.description: No sooner has Ash begun what he hopes will be his final gym battle in the Johto League than Team Rocket once again throws a wrench into his plans, making off with the Dragon Fang.

media.title: Great Bowls of Fire
media.description: Immediately after entering an area considered sacrosanct by the Dragon Pokémon that dwell there, Team Rocket sets off a chain of events that enrages the area's Dragonite guardian.

media.title: Better Eight Than Never
media.description: Having finally seen stability restored to the Blackthorn Gym, Ash and Claire face off in a gym battle.

media.title: Why? Wynaut
media.description: Having defeated Clair and earned his eighth gym badge, Ash must now set out for the Johto League championship, which he learns is to be held on Mt Silver in three months time.

media.title: Just Add Water
media.description: On the road back to New Bark Town, Ash and friends stop for a rest near the ocean. There they spot a sign advertising a synchronized Pokémon swimming event.

media.title: Lapras of Luxury
media.description: Ash and friends return to New Bark Town, Professor Elm sends him on an errand to retrieve a Pokémon egg from a nearby marine Pokémon laboratory.

media.title: Hatch Me If You Can
media.description: Questions as to what Pokémon waits inside the egg Ash and friends have been carrying for Professor Elm are finally answered when it hatches into a Larvitar.

media.title: Entei at Your Own Risk
media.description: As Ash and friends continue their travels with Larvitar, it remains wary of all other Pokémon and people, particularly of Misty.

media.title: A Crowning Achievement
media.description: Brock leads Ash and Misty toward a beautiful lake he has read about in his guidebook, but when they arrive at its supposed location, they find nothing but a dried-up stream, surrounded by a number of thirsty Slowpoke.

media.title: Here's Lookin' at You, Elekid
media.description: A troublesome Elekid begins harassing Larvitar only moments before Team Rocket swoops in and captures both rare Pokémon in a high-tensile steel net.

media.title: You're a Star, Larvitar
media.description: Ash and friends report back to Professor Elm as they reach the base of Mount Silver, where they hope to return their Larvitar to its birthplace.

media.title: Address Unown!
media.description: A strange energy is emitted from the sky and an Unown pops out, landing right on Misty's head!

media.title: Mother of All Battles
media.description: Now that they have finally gaining Larvitar's trust, the group head towards the Pokémon Reserve on Mt. Silver, as led by Larvitar.

media.title: Pop Goes the Sneasel
media.description: With Larvitar returned to its rightful home, Ash and company make their way to Silver Town for the Silver Conference Tournament.

media.title: A Claim to Flame!
media.description: Gary is set on entering the Silver Conference, and is determined that this time he will be able to make it all the way, and beat Ash!

media.title: Love, Pokémon Style
media.description: Ash begins the Silver Conference Tournament in Division H against two opponents.

media.title: Tie One On!
media.description: As the Johto League Silver Conference gets underway, Ash will take on Jackson from New Bark Town. Ash is looking forward to the match, but perhaps not as much as his Bulbasaur.

media.title: The Ties That Bind
media.description: Ash is about to take on his long time rival, Gary Oak, in the next battle of the Johto League Silver Conference, and he's determined to do everything he can to win.

media.title: Can't Beat the Heat
media.description: Our hero is in the middle of the first match of the championship tournament at the Johto League Silver Conference. His opponent is his long time rival—Gary Oak.

media.title: Playing with Fire!
media.description: Ash is battling Harrison from Hoenn at the Johto League Silver Conference. It's a close match the whole way through, but one by one Harrison knocks out Totodile, Snorlax, and Noctowl.

media.title: Johto Photo Finish
media.description: The scorching battle between Ash and Harrison rages on, with Charizard taking on Blaziken, a Pokémon from the Hoenn region!

media.title: Gotta Catch Ya Later!
media.description: With the Johto League Silver Conference behind them, Ash, Brock and Misty head back to Viridian City to relax.

media.title: Hoenn Alone!
media.description: Ash has left all of his Pokémon behind in Pallet Town—except Pikachu—and boarded a ship bound for Littleroot Town in Hoenn. Unfortunately, Team Rocket is on board as well.

title: Pokémon Advanced
description: Ash and Pikachu’s journey reaches the Hoenn region in the sixth season of Pokémon the Series. Now on Pokémon TV!

media.title: Get the Show on the Road
media.description: Team Rocket's failed attempt to catch Pikachu has left the little yellow Pokémon dangerously ill. Littleroot Town has no Pokémon Center so Ash turns to Professor Birch for help.

media.title: A Ruin with a View
media.description: Now that Pikachu is feeling better, Ash is ready to head to Oldale Town to sign up for the Hoenn League.

media.title: There's No Place like Hoenn
media.description: Ash and May have made it all the way to Petalburg City—the first city with a gym. Ash is very excited to take on the gym leader.

media.title: You Can Never Taillow
media.description: Ash, May and May's little brother Max are now en route to Rustboro City—and they're hungry! No one remembered to pack lunch.

media.title: In the Knicker of Time
media.description: Brock is ready to travel again and has joined up with Ash, May and Max as the journey on towards Rustboro City.

media.title: A Poached Ego
media.description: Our heroes are headed for Rustboro City, where Ash hopes to have his first real gym battle in Hoenn.

media.title: Tree's a Crowd
media.description: Deep in the woods, Ash spies a Treecko. He's wanted to catch a Treecko since he first saw one at Professor Birch's laboratory.

media.title: A Tail with a Twist
media.description: When Team Rocket sees Treecko knocked down and hurt by a Seviper, they decide that they must have that Seviper.

media.title: Taming of the Shroomish
media.description: Ash, May, Brock and Max have arrived at a small city on their way to Rustboro City. Brock decides to stock up on supplies, while Max is eager to go hunting for city dwelling Pokémon.

media.title: You Said a Mouthful
media.description: En route to Rustboro City, Ash and the gang pass by an unofficial gym boasting the world's most powerful Pokémon.

media.title: A Bite to Remember
media.description: As our heroes travel on towards Rustboro City, they stumble into a forest filled with many different kinds of Pokémon.

media.title: The Lotad Lowdown
media.description: Ash, Pikachu, Brock, May and Max decide to cool off in a picturesque lake en route to Rustboro City. But they're not the only one's splashing around!

media.title: All Things Bright and Beautifly
media.description: Ash, Brock, Max and May have just arrived at a Contest Hall. Janet and Chaz, two experienced Pokémon Coordinators, teach the gang all about Contests.

media.title: All in a Day's Wurmple
media.description: As the gang continues to make their way towards Rustboro City, May spots a Wurmple that she's dying to catch—but she's not the only one with her eye on the cute little bug Pokémon.

media.title: Gonna Rule the School
media.description: Now that Ash and friends have arrived in Rustboro City, they're taking a moment to sightsee. They bump into a schoolteacher, Roxanne, and her class on a class trip.

media.title: The Winner by a Nosepass
media.description: Pikachu is getting pretty good at its Iron Tail attack and that's a good thing. Ash is finally about to take on Roxanne, the leader of the Rustboro City Gym.

media.title: Stairway to Devon
media.description: Now that he's received a badge from the Rustboro City Gym, Ash is ready to leave Rustboro and head off to Dewford Island for his next gym battle. May has other ideas.

media.title: On a Wingull and a Prayer
media.description: Ash enjoyed meeting the president of Devon Corp. and learning a little about Team Aqua, a dangerous group of evildoers, but now he really wants to get to Dewford Island.

media.title: Sharpedo Attack!
media.description: Ash and company are sailing toward Dewford Town, thanks to their new friends Mr. Briney and his Wingull, Peeko.

media.title: Brave the Wave!
media.description: Ash charges out in the early morning, ready to challenge the Dewford Gym. Upon arriving at the door to the Gym, Ash is bowled over by a group of energetic surfers charging out of the door.

media.title: Which Wurmple's Which?
media.description: Everyone is getting up and getting ready for breakfast, but Ash is no where in sight. He is found outside the Pokémon Center, anxiously awaiting news on his Treecko.

media.title: A Hole Lotta Trouble
media.description: Ash and the gang finally arrive at Granite Cave. Team Rocket is already in the cave, perfecting their next attempt to capture Pikachu.

media.title: Gone Corphishin'
media.description: Team Rocket is lounging on the beach when suddenly a mysterious creature zooms along the beach and launches Team Rocket out of sight.

media.title: A Corphish Out of Water!
media.description: Ash is taking care of his Poké Balls and May is worrying about why her Wurmple isn't eating when Team Rocket appears and snatches Pikachu.

media.title: A Mudkip Mission!
media.description: As our heroes set out on their journey again, they encounter a waterfall.

media.title: Turning Over a New Nuzleaf!
media.description: Ash and the gang begin to head back through Granite Cave so Ash can have a re-match with Brawly. Along the way, Corphish startles the same Loudred that the group ran into before.

media.title: A Three Team Scheme
media.description: Ash and his team train on the beach. They soon discover that Professor Birch is in the area doing research on Wingull.

media.title: Seeing Is Believing
media.description: Team Rocket is devising a plan to capture a Seedot. Jessie is gushing over how wonderful it's going to be when her Silcoon (which is actually a Cascoon) evolves into a Beautifly. James and Meowth shudder at the impending doom.

media.title: Ready, Willing and Sableye!
media.description: It's another relaxing day at the beach for Ash and his friends. Meanwhile, Team Rocket happens upon an abandoned mine shaft and investigates, hoping to find forgotten riches inside.

media.title: A Meditite Fight!
media.description: Ash is training his Pokémon at the beach when a young female surfer comes to shore and challenges Ash to a battle, explaining that she trains with Brawly and that she is one of his best students.

media.title: Just One of the Geysers!
media.description: Ash is on his way to his second battle with Brawly. Team Rocket landed in Brawly's training area by accident and set about investigating his refrigerator.

media.title: Abandon Ship!
media.description: Ash and the gang are headed for Slateport City in a motorboat so that May can try her hand at a Pokémon Contest. Team Rocket is on board, disguised as sailors.

media.title: Now That's Flower Power!
media.description: Ash and the gang have arrived at Slateport City and May is busy getting her Beautifly ready for the Pokémon Contest.

media.title: Having a Wailord of a Time!
media.description: May is eagerly preparing her Beautifly for the Pokémon Contest while Max watches her Torchic. May discovers a beached Wailord and contacts Nurse Joy at the Pokémon Center.

media.title: Win, Lose, or Drew!
media.description: May enters Beautifly in the beauty contest, but Team Rocket is too late to enter their Dustox. At the competitions, the person in line right before May is none other than her rival Drew.

media.title: The Spheal of Approval!
media.description: Fresh out of the contest, our heroes are exploring the bustling city of Slateport. Ash and Max want to check out the Sea Museum but discover that it is closed.

media.title: Jump for Joy!
media.description: Ash and company arrive at the Pokémon Center, but Nurse Joy is no where to be found. Pikachu inspects the room where she was and suddenly falls asleep. Ash follows it and meets the same fate.

media.title: A Different Kind of Misty!
media.description: Ash and his friends hear Team Rocket passing by in their balloon and Team Rocket, noticing them back, take the opportunity to try to capture Pikachu.

media.title: A Poké-BLOCK Party!
media.description: After making it to Mauville City, Ash and the gang see a sign stating that whoever can make it through the trick house will win a lifetime supply of PokéBlocks. Ash and the gang decide to try their luck.

media.title: What's With Wattson?
media.description: Ash and company are finally at the Mauville Gym. They have an electrifying introduction to Wattson, the Gym's leader, who specializes in Electric-type Pokémon.

title: Pokémon: Advanced Challenge
description: Is Ash up to the Advanced Challenge of facing both Team Magma and Team Aqua? Find out in the seventh season of Pokémon the Series, now on Pokémon TV!

media.title: What You Seed is What You Get
media.description: Ash and friends are leaving Mauville City, but Ash wants to go to the Pokémon Gym in Lavaridge Town while May wants to compete in a Pokémon Contest at Fallarbor Town.

media.title: Let Bagons Be Bagons
media.description: Ash and friends are headed to Fallarbor Town when they are nearly hit by a Bagon jumping off a cliff.

media.title: The Princess and the Togepi
media.description: Ash and friends welcome an old friend—Misty! She's received an invitation to a Togepi Festival, and is soon greeted by Team Rocket disguised as the operating committee for the festival.

media.title: A Togepi Mirage
media.description: Shedinja attacks Misty and friends, but they are protected by Togepi using Safeguard. Everyone is then transported into the Togepi Paradise, located inside the mirage floating above the temple.

media.title: Candid Camerupt
media.description: Ash and his friends are walking through the desert when they pass out because of the heat. They are rescued by the Winstrate Family.

media.title: Love at First Flight
media.description: Ash and friends are still on their way to Fallarbor Town and stop by Lake May for a rest, where they spot an Illumise and some Volbeat practicing for the May Festival.

media.title: I Feel Skitty!
media.description: May is practicing for her next Pokémon Contest, when Torchic finds a Skitty in the bushes. May wants to catch it, but it's too sick to battle.

media.title: Zig Zag Zangoose
media.description: Ash and friends are traveling when a Zangoose runs up in front of them. It is followed by its Trainer, their old friend Nicolai. Ash challenges Nicolai to a Pokémon battle.

media.title: Maxxed Out!
media.description: Ash and friends stop at a Pokémon Center where May's Skitty pops out of its Poké Ball and causes trouble. A kid that looks a lot like comes up to yell at them—and his name is also Max!

media.title: Pros and Con Artists
media.description: May and friends finally arrive in Fallarbor Town, ready for the next Pokémon Contest.

media.title: Come What May!
media.description: May is competing in her second Pokémon Contest and manages to make it to the next round along with Drew, Grace, and a disguised Jessie.

media.title: Cheer Pressure
media.description: Ash meets an old friend: Batcher from Mt. Lighthouse! He's a member of a pep squad school that cheers at Pokémon battles, led by a man named Sheridan.

media.title: Game Winning Assist
media.description: Ash and friends are fleeing a group of rampaging Slugma along the Fiery Path, when they escape down a hill and end up on a Numel ranch.

media.title: Fight for the Meteorite
media.description: The gang rushes to the cable car headed up Mt. Chimney, boarding it just in time along with a disguised Team Rocket.

media.title: Poetry Commotion!
media.description: Ash and friends arrive in Lavaridge Town. Ash heads straight for the Gym, where the Gym Leader Flannery is running around on fire.

media.title: Going, Going, Yawn
media.description: Ash uses Corphish in his Gym battle with Flannery. Flannery chooses Magcargo first, which is defeated by Corphish's Crabhammer.

media.title: Going for a Spinda
media.description: Ash decides to head to Petalburg City for his next Gym battle. On the road, the gang runs into a group of Spinda.

media.title: All Torkoal, No Play
media.description: Ash and friends are walking through the Valley of Steel on their way to Petalburg Gym when they encounter a Torkoal being attacked by a Skarmory and several Magnemite.

media.title: Manectric Charge
media.description: Ash and friends return to Mauville City, where they encounter a carnival run by Team Rocket. They let all their Pokémon out to enjoy the festivities, and Team Rocket tries to steal them.

media.title: Delcatty Got Your Tongue
media.description: The kids are on their way to Verdanturf Town when they are waylaid by another Team Rocket scheme.

media.title: Disaster of Disguise
media.description: Drew loses a Pokémon battle to the mysterious "Phantom," a masked Pokémon Trainer using a Dusclops.

media.title: Disguise Da Limit
media.description: Jessie is competing under an alias in a Contest, and her Dustox takes the lead in the first round.  May's Skitty fails to do a Blizzard attack, losing points and putting May behind.

media.title: Take the Lombre Home
media.description: Ash and friends are headed to Petalburg City so he can earn his fifth Gym badge. They fall into yet another Team Rocket scheme to steal Pikachu but are saved by a wild Solrock.

media.title: True Blue Swablu
media.description: May and friends are walking through the woods when they find a wounded Swablu. Swablu puts the kids to sleep with Sing, but Torchic wakes them up by pecking their noses.

media.title: Gulpin It Down
media.description: Ash and friends are in a town close to Petalburg City, when their picnic is gobbled up by a passing Gulpin. They overhear an emergency announcement instructing everyone to evacuate.

media.title: Exploud and Clear
media.description: Ash and friends are eating lunch in the woods when they notice that Treecko has wandered off. After failing to convince the Grass-type to come down from a tree, lunch is disrupted by a rampaging Loudred.

media.title: Go Go Ludicolo
media.description: Ash and friends are almost to Petalburg City. Ash can't wait to battle Gym Leader Norman, while May and Max look forward to seeing their parents again.

media.title: A Double Dilemma
media.description: The friends arrive in North Petalburg and stop by the Pokémon Center. Team Rocket arrives in town and they decide to disguise themselves.

media.title: Love, Petalburg Style!
media.description: Ash and friends finally arrive in Petalburg City. Ash heads to the Pokémon Center to take care of his team while everyone else visits May and Max's house.

media.title: Balance of Power
media.description: Ash challenges Gym Leader Norman for a badge. While they battle, Team Rocket is busy digging a tunnel under the Gym.

media.title: Six Pack Attack
media.description: Ash and friends decide to visit Professor Birch. On the road they are nearly run over by Birch in his jeep, on his way to the port to pick up Professor Oak.

media.title: The Bicker the Better
media.description: The kids are on their way to Fortree City, but May is delaying them. Ash starts to argue with her, and the two kids continue to bicker as they walk. They are interrupted by a couple named Andi and Oscar, who challenge May and Ash to a tag battle.

media.title: Grass Hysteria!
media.description: Ash and friends are lost in a forest when they are attacked by a Skarmory that kidnaps May.

media.title: Hokey Poké Balls
media.description: The kids arrive in a city where May lets her Bulbasaur to enjoy the scenery. Meanwhile, Team Rocket is at the Pokémon Center  making "repairs" to the transporter machine.

media.title: Whiscash and Ash
media.description: The kids have stopped at a lakeside camp site on their way to Fortree City. Ash trips and drops his badge case into the lake, where it is eaten up by a giant Whiscash.

media.title: Me, Myself and Time
media.description: The kids are crossing a mountain in the fog, and Ash trips and slides down a cliff with Pikachu. He encounters a mysterious woman singing a strange song.

media.title: A Fan with a Plan
media.description: May is headed for the Rubello Town Pokémon Contest, where at least one ribbon is needed to enter.

media.title: Cruisin' For a Losin'
media.description: The Rubello Pokémon Contest begins! Savannah is still nervous, but May is overconfident.  Both of them do well in the first round performances.

media.title: Pearls Are a Spoink's Best Friend
media.description: The kids are eating breakfast when Skitty runs off and encounters a Spoink that has lost its pearl. The Spoink shows how it rolled away, so the kids help look around the forest.

media.title: That's Just Swellow
media.description: While a competition is going on, Jessie and Meowth have been tricking Trainers into leaving their Pokémon behind for a special "relaxing" treatment. They trap the Pokémon into a net and prepare to run.

media.title: Take This House and Shuppet
media.description: Ash and friends are lost outside when it starts to rain. They eventually make their way to a mansion and get locked inside.

media.title: A Shroomish Skirmish
media.description: Team Rocket is starving, and they end up stealing apples from a group of Shroomish. Some of the Shroomish become angry enough that they evolve into Breloom, then attack Team Rocket.

media.title: Unfair Weather Friends
media.description: Ash and the gang are headed to Fortree City when it starts raining and then snowing. They run for shelter and meet a Castform who leads them onward.

media.title: Who's Flying Now?
media.description: Ash and friends climb the steps to the Fortree City Gym—only to find out that the Gym Leader is busy in town with the Feather Carnival.

media.title: Sky High Gym Battle!
media.description: Ash begins his Gym battle with Winona by sending out Grovyle against her Altaria. Grovyle takes out Altaria with Leaf Blade. Next up is Pelipper, a Water-and-Flying-type Pokémon.

media.title: Lights, Camerupt, Action!
media.description: Ash is ready for his next badge—which means heading to Mossdeep City. To get there, Ash and friends will need to take the ferry in Lilycove City.

media.title: Crazy as a Lunatone
media.description: Ken and Mary of the Pokémon Mystery Club are once again looking for a Pokémon from outer space, checking the site of a meteor crash.

media.title: The Garden of Eatin'
media.description: The kids have stopped by the Banana Slakoth Garden on their way to Lilycove City, but the gate is closed and the trees have no fruit on them.

media.title: A Scare to Remember
media.description: As Ash and friends walk to Lilycove City, a tree comes crashing down in front of them—pushed over by Team Rocket in their newest giant robot!

media.title: PokéBlock, Stock, and Berry
media.description: The kids finally arrive in Lilycove City, and Ash is starving. They decide to head to a restaurant that serves omelets, but Pikachu runs off, leading them to the berry market.

media.title: Lessons in Lilycove
media.description: Combusken's Fire Spin is spiraling out of control in the Lilycove Contest Hall. Combusken protects May, who takes control by having the Fire- and Fighting-type unleash a fireball and perform Sky Uppercut.

media.title: Judgment Day!
media.description: The kids are running for the ferry to Lilycove and jump on the boat they see leaving only to discover it's actually a boat to Bomba Island. Once they arrive on the island, they meet a young Trainer named Jimmy.

title: Pokémon: Advanced Battle
description: Groudon, Kyogre, the Grand Festival, the Hoenn League—what DOESN’T Ash deal with in the eighth season of Pokémon the Series? See it now on Pokémon TV!

media.title: Clamperl of Wisdom
media.description: Our heroes reconnect with an unlucky Spoink, and it's still having trouble holding onto its pearl!

media.title: The Relicanth Really Can
media.description: Ash and friends join a treasure hunter to explore the deep sea, but Team Rocket is right behind them!

media.title: The Evolutionary War
media.description: When a Gorebyss-versus-Huntail rivalry develops between two islands, our heroes must get to the bottom of it!

media.title: Training Wrecks
media.description: The residents of Muscle Island are dedicated to physical fitness—but can they keep up with Ash in a Pokémon battle?

media.title: Gaining Groudon
media.description: After a rescue at sea, our heroes find themselves aboard Team Magma's submarine and learn more about the group's plan for world domination!

media.title: The Scuffle of Legends
media.description: Team Aqua and Team Magma have awakened the ancient Legendary Pokémon Groudon and Kyogre! Can Ash and friends escape?

media.title: It's Still Rocket Roll to Me
media.description: A Team Rocket strike on Mossdeep City drags our heroes—plus the city's twin Gym Leaders—into a space-shuttle scheme!

media.title: Solid as a Solrock
media.description: Ash takes on the Mossdeep Gym, going up against two Gym Leaders at once!

media.title: Vanity Affair
media.description: After winning his seventh Gym badge, Ash can't stop bragging about his battle skills…until he runs into a member of the Elite Four!

media.title: Where's Armaldo?
media.description: In an island nature preserve, Ash and friends come face to face with several Pokémon thought to be extinct!

media.title: A Cacturne for the Worse
media.description: May competes in a Pokémon Contest, where another Coordinator tries to sabotage her performance!

media.title: Claydol Big and Tall
media.description: When our heroes discover an enormous Poké Ball on an island, Team Rocket's meddling unleashes an ancient destructive force!

media.title: Once in a Mawile
media.description: Ash and friends meet a talented Trainer who performs a ribbon dance with her Mawile…until Team Rocket gets in the way!

media.title: Beg, Burrow, and Steal
media.description: To help a local researcher, our heroes explore a massive underground labyrinth created by a group of Trapinch…and get into some trouble along the way!

media.title: Absol-ute Disaster
media.description: An Absol appears to warn a village of danger, but the villagers think it's the one causing the trouble! Can our heroes clear up this misunderstanding?

media.title: Let It Snow, Let It Snow, Let It Snorunt!
media.description: When a mischievous Snorunt steals Ash's hard-earned Gym badges, Ash chases after it—right into a raging snowstorm!

media.title: Do I Hear a Ralts?
media.description: Max finds an injured Ralts and tries to get it to a Pokémon Center, but its friends Gardevoir and Kirlia think our heroes are trying to steal it!

media.title: The Great Eight Fate!
media.description: Ash gets ready for his final Gym battle in the Hoenn region: a Double Battle against Gym Leader Juan, who used to be a Pokémon Coordinator!

media.title: Eight Ain't Enough
media.description: Ash and Juan battle it out in the Sootopolis Gym! Can Ash win his eighth Gym badge to qualify for the Hoenn League?

media.title: Showdown At Linoone!
media.description: When May discovers that two of her Poké Balls are missing, she naturally assumes it's Team Rocket! But the culprit could be someone else entirely…

media.title: Who, What, When, Where, Wynaut?
media.description: When Team Rocket interrupts a practice battle between May and her rival Drew, our heroes and their Pokémon have to sort out a big mix-up!

media.title: Date Expectations
media.description: Our heroes are delayed by a herd of Donphan on their way to Pacifidlog Town! Can May make it onto the ferry in time for her final Pokémon Contest?

media.title: Mean With Envy
media.description: May enters the Pacifidlog Contest, where she goes up against rivals Joshua and Erica, plus a mysterious competitor known only as "The Jester"…

media.title: Pacifidlog Jam
media.description: May competes against an unusual Meowth in the second round of the Pacifidlog Contest. Can she win the last ribbon she needs to qualify for the Grand Festival?

media.title: Berry, Berry Interesting
media.description: When our heroes stumble upon a wonderful berry harvest, May takes the opportunity to make some Pokéblocks for the Grand Festival, drawing the attention of a hungry Munchlax!

media.title: Less Is Morrison
media.description: Ash meets Morrison, another Trainer who's on his way to compete in the Hoenn League, and the two immediately become fierce rivals!

media.title: The Ribbon Cup Caper!
media.description: Aboard a luxury liner bound for Slateport City and the Grand Festival, our heroes must help Officer Jenny catch a master thief!

media.title: Hi Ho Silver Wind!
media.description: On the first day of the Grand Festival, May runs into her deceitful rival Harley once more!

media.title: Deceit and Assist
media.description: Ash meets a Coordinator whose ribbons have been stolen, and May listens to some bad advice before her first performance in the Grand Festival!

media.title: Rhapsody in Drew
media.description: May is up against Harley in the second round of the Grand Festival! Can she triumph over his treacherous tactics?

media.title: Island Time
media.description: When our heroes win free tickets to Ever Grande City for the Hoenn League Championships, they're delighted—until it becomes clear this is another of Team Rocket's schemes!

media.title: Like a Meowth to a Flame
media.description: While training for the Hoenn League, Ash meets fellow Trainer Tyson and his Meowth in boots, and they discover that the ceremonial torch has been stolen!

media.title: Saved by the Beldum
media.description: Ash, Morrison, and Tyson register for the Hoenn League, and it appears that Tyson's Meowth has an unfortunate past…

media.title: From Brags to Riches
media.description: In the qualifying rounds, Ash faces a serious challenge: he has to win three matches in a row, and each match is a Double Battle!

media.title: Shocks and Bonds
media.description: Ash has made it through the qualifying rounds, but now he faces an impressive Trainer named Katie in a full battle, where both of them will use all six of their Pokémon!

media.title: A Judgment Brawl
media.description: Ash has fallen behind in his full battle against Katie! Can he recover and make it to the second round?

media.title: Choose It or Lose It
media.description: Ash faces his friend and rival Morrison in the second round of the Hoenn League!

media.title: At the End of the Fray
media.description: Ash goes up against his rival Tyson in the quarterfinals of the Hoenn League!

media.title: The Scheme Team
media.description: The Hoenn League is over, and it's time for Ash to bid farewell to his traveling companions and head home—but he can't resist one more challenge from a Gym Leader along the way!

media.title: The Right Place and the Right Mime
media.description: Max and May come to visit Ash in Pallet Town, along with Misty and Brock, and they all make plans for another journey together—this time, to the Battle Frontier!

media.title: A Real Cleffa-Hanger
media.description: Our heroes stop for a picnic at the base of Mt. Moon, where they encounter the rarely seen Cleffa, Clefairy, and Clefable!

media.title: Numero Uno Articuno
media.description: On the way to Ash's first match at the Battle Frontier, our heroes see the Legendary Pokémon Articuno flying through a snowstorm!

media.title: The Symbol Life
media.description: Ash calls in his old friend Charizard to help in his battle against Frontier Brain Noland and his friend Articuno!

media.title: Hooked on Onix
media.description: Provoked by Team Rocket, hordes of Rock-type Pokémon attack our heroes on their way to the Battle Arena!

media.title: Rough, Tough Jigglypuff
media.description: Ash and friends fall into a trap set by a man who wants to catch a Jigglypuff for his daughter's birthday!

media.title: On Cloud Arcanine
media.description: May and her rival Drew go after the same Arcanine, both hoping to catch it for their next Contest!

media.title: Sitting Psyduck
media.description: Ash and friends rescue a sad Psyduck from a group of Fighting types, but they can't figure out how to cheer it up…

media.title: Hail to the Chef!
media.description: Our heroes and Team Rocket check out a new restaurant owned by two sisters who can't stop squabbling!

media.title: Caterpie's Big Dilemma
media.description: After a scientific experiment goes awry, Ash and friends try to track down a Caterpie that has grown to enormous proportions!

media.title: The Saffron Con
media.description: Our heroes are in Saffron City for May's first Pokémon Contest in the Kanto region—and her shady rival Harley is competing, too!

media.title: A Hurdle for Squirtle
media.description: The Saffron Pokémon Contest is under way! Can May win her first ribbon in the Kanto region?

media.title: Pasta la Vista!
media.description: Ash checks out the Fighting Dojo in Saffron City and ends up getting recruited as a new student!

title: Pokémon: Battle Frontier
description: Ash and Pikachu return to the Kanto region to take on the Battle Frontier in the ninth season of Pokémon the Series. Now on Pokémon TV!

media.title: Fear Factor Phony!
media.description: On a dark and stormy night, Ash and his friends find a deserted town near an old mine. Inside the mine is a Haunter, who scares our heroes away!

media.title: Sweet Baby James
media.description: When May's Munchlax gets sick and there's no Pokémon Center nearby, it's a kindly old couple (and their Mime Jr.) to the rescue!

media.title: A Chip Off the Old Brock
media.description: A disguised Team Rocket tries to clean out a pharmacy using Meowth in a Snorlax suit, but McCauley and Brock drive them off.

media.title: Wheel of Frontier
media.description: Ash is about to reach the Battle Arena, but Team Rocket has gotten there ahead of him! They're pretending to be students of Greta, the Arena Tycoon.

media.title: May's Egg-cellent Adventure
media.description: As Ash and his friends head for the next Battle Frontier stop, May spots a lovely farm. But when she takes a closer look, she's zapped by Voltorb!

media.title: Weekend Warrior
media.description: It's time for the Silver Town Pokémon Contest, and May is ready to win! As the show starts, one last competitor arrives late: a businessman named Jeremy.

media.title: On Olden Pond
media.description: Ash and his friends visit a famous fishing spot that looks oddly abandoned. Ash still manages to hook a Crawdaunt, which he challenges with Corphish.

media.title: Tactics Theatrics
media.description: Ash has finally reached the Battle Dome, and what a reception! An eager crowd of journalists wants to meet the new challenger who's going to take on Tucker, the famous Dome Ace.

media.title: Reversing the Charges
media.description: On the way to the Battle Pike, Ash and his friends spot some strange and stormy weather nearby. What's more, an irritable Elekid is busy zapping all the local Pokémon!

media.title: The Green Guardian
media.description: Celebi comes to the rescue of Pokémon under threat from a forest fire, but the effort leaves it exhausted and it creates a giant tangle of vines to protect itself.

media.title: From Cradle to Save
media.description: Ash takes a break to train with Donphan and Pikachu, and Donphan uncovers a young ninja named Evian.

media.title: Time-Warp Heals All Wounds
media.description: While our heroes are stopped at a Pokémon Center, Squirtle runs off—never a good idea when Team Rocket is lurking nearby!

media.title: Queen of the Serpentine
media.description: Ash heads for the Battle Pike ahead of his friends, and finds himself at a facility staffed by three suspiciously familiar faces and their Wobbuffet.

media.title: Off the Unbeaten Path
media.description: Ash and his friends enter an orienteering competition on Potpourri Island!

media.title: Harley Rides Again
media.description: May is preparing for the Pokémon Contest in Wisteria Town when her old rival Harley shows up and vows to beat her. He's even got one more Ribbon than she does!

media.title: Odd Pokémon Out
media.description: The team is on Camomile Island, en route to May's next Pokémon Contest on Chrysanthemum Island. Everyone lets their Pokémon out to have some fun.

media.title: Spontaneous Combusken
media.description: May is about to enter her next Contest on Chrysanthemum Island. During a practice battle between Munchlax and Combusken, May meets Brianna.

media.title: Cutting the Ties That Bind
media.description: Ash has arrived at Metallica Island, home of the Battle Palace. He's ready for battle, but Sceptile isn't—its attack moves still aren't working and it runs away in frustration.

media.title: Ka Boom With A View
media.description: Ash's Battle Palace challenge against Spenser is about to begin, and it's going to be one big battle when the island itself is the true battleground!

media.title: King and Queen For a Day
media.description: On their way to the Battle Tower, our heroes win a free massage from a thinly-disguised Team Rocket. The treat turns out to be a trap when Team Rocket tries to snatch their Pokémon.

media.title: Curbing the Crimson Tide
media.description: There's big trouble in the big city when Ash and our friends pay a visit—a mysterious talking Pokémon known as Red Lighting has been battling all the Trainers in town.

media.title: What I Did For Love
media.description: Our heroes are in Gardenia Town for May's next Pokémon Contest, and there are a few new faces to meet. Say hello to Mollie and Yuma: one's a beginning Coordinator, the other an experienced pro here as a spectator!

media.title: Three Jynx and a Baby
media.description: On their way to the Battle Tower, Ash and his friends come across a stray Smoochum. But before they can get close, they get a very chilly reception from three Jynx who are very protective of Smoochum.

media.title: Talking a Good Game
media.description: As Ash eagerly heads for the Battle Tower and his sixth challenge, he accidentally stirs up a horde of Beedrill who chase him down!

media.title: Second Time's the Charm
media.description: Ash lost his first Battle Tower challenge, but he won't give up. He's out practicing with his team the next day, until Tauros stirs up a Beedrill nest that even Anabel can't calm them down.

media.title: Pokémon Ranger - Deoxys' Crisis (Part 1)
media.description: Our heroes spot a confused flock of Pokémon and realize something isn't right, especially once an unusual aurora appears in the sky and their Poké Balls and PokéNav stop working!

media.title: Pokémon Ranger - Deoxys' Crisis (Part 2)
media.description: With Meowth and Max both vanished after an encounter with Deoxys, Team Rocket makes a truce with the twerps so they can rescue their favorite talking Pokémon.

media.title: All That Glitters Is Not Golden
media.description: Ash and May spot an amazing golden Sudowoodo at the edge of a lake, but it knocks Ash's Poké Ball away when he tries to catch it.

media.title: New Plot, Odd Lot!
media.description: May is feeling the pressure at the Mulberry City Pokémon Contest, her last chance to get a fifth ribbon before the Grand Festival. To make things worse, Harley shows up!

media.title: Going for Choke
media.description: The competition is underway at the Mulberry Town Pokémon Contest, where Harley has teamed up with Team Rocket to plot May's downfall.

media.title: The Ole' Berate and Switch
media.description: Our heroes come across a one-day Pokémon Battle Tournament secretly run by Butch and Cassidy, who are having their own problems getting along.

media.title: Grating Spaces
media.description: Our heroes have finally made it back to Pewter City, where Brock once again comes home to find the Pewter Gym looking stranger than ever.

media.title: Battling the Enemy Within
media.description: Ash is really excited to get to the Battle Pyramid, but he falls down a hole into a strange ruin. When Team Rocket goes to check it out, they end up falling in as well.

media.title: Slaking Kong
media.description: On the way to the Grand Festival, our heroes are swarmed by a group of Aipom who swipe Ash's hat and May's ribbon case!

media.title: May, We Harley Drew'd Ya
media.description: May has arrived at the Indigo Plateau Grand Festival, where there are many familiar faces in town. Team Rocket is turning over a new leaf as Contest commentators.

media.title: Thinning the Hoard
media.description: May, Drew, Harley, and Solidad are all competing in the Grand Festival, and it's time for their Pokémon to show off their best moves.

media.title: Channeling the Battle Zone
media.description: May and Drew are in a battle to reach the final four of the Grand Festival, and both Coordinators have some powerful combinations up their sleeve.

media.title: Aipom and Circumstance
media.description: When Ash's new Aipom plays another prank on him, it leads them both to a village that's preparing to select this year's King.

media.title: Strategy Tomorrow – Comedy Tonight
media.description: On the way to Fennel Valley and Ash's rematch with Brandon, our heroes meet Chatot, a Pokémon that can imitate anything it hears. However, this Chatot keeps running away from its Trainer, Audrey!

media.title: Duels of the Jungle
media.description: On the way to Fennel Valley, Ash's Aipom scampers away and runs into a Weavile with an attitude. Aipom's up for a battle, but Weavile deals it a harsh defeat!

media.title: Overjoyed
media.description: Ash has reached Fennel Valley at last, where he plans to challenge Brandon to a rematch—but Brandon won't be back until tomorrow! Instead, our hero is welcomed by an enthusiastic Nurse Joy.

media.title: The Unbeatable Lightness of Seeing
media.description: Ash is still recovering from his defeat at the Battle Pyramid, while May is also melancholy about her own defeat at the Grand Festival.

media.title: Pinch Healing
media.description: At the Fennel Valley Pokémon Center, Ash is practicing attacks with his Pokémon while Brock is excited to be cooking with Nurse Joy.

media.title: Gathering the Gang of Four
media.description: At the Fennel Valley Pokémon Center, Ash gets a special delivery from Oak's Lab—his Bulbasaur. Officer Jenny soon arrives with his Squirtle, and his Charizard flies in too.

media.title: Pace - The Final Frontier
media.description: With Charizard out of the battle for his rematch against Pyramid King Brandon, Ash calls out Bulbasaur. Dusclops performs Mean Look again, while Bulbasaur wraps the Ghost-type with Leech Seed.

media.title: Once More with Reeling
media.description: The kids are at Terracotta Town, where May and Max will catch a boat back home to Hoenn. The town happens to be hosting a festival, complete with its very own Pokémon Contest.

media.title: Home Is Where the Start Is!
media.description: The smoke finally clears at the Terracotta Town Pokémon Contest, and the winner is revealed—it is a tie between May and Ash!

title: Pokémon: Diamond and Pearl
description: Travel to the Sinnoh region with Ash and Pikachu as Pokémon: Diamond and Pearl arrives on Pokémon TV!

media.title: Following a Maiden's Voyage
media.description: It's always exciting when new Pokémon Trainers receives their first Pokémon, but for a girl named Dawn, things will be far more exciting than she'd ever imagined!

media.title: Two Degrees of Separation
media.description: Dawn and Piplup's Pokémon journey is off to a bumpy start! She needs to catch Pokémon so she can become a great Pokémon Coordinator like her mom, but both her and Piplup are having trouble getting the hang of things.

media.title: When Pokémon Worlds Collide
media.description: Paul catches a Starly and challenges Ash to a battle—but without Pikachu, Ash doesn't have enough Pokémon for a 3-on-3 battle!

media.title: Dawn of a New Era
media.description: Dawn is still trying to catch her first wild Pokémon, but Ash's coaching isn't helping at all and both Trainers are getting annoyed.

media.title: Gettin' Twiggy With It
media.description: Team Rocket's latest Pikachu-snatching plan slips up, and Pikachu ends up lost in the woods. It's found by a friendly Turtwig who defends Pikachu from Team Rocket, but mistakes Ash for a foe as well!

media.title: Different Strokes for Different Blokes
media.description: When Ash runs into his new rival Paul, Ash wants a rematch—and a chance to show off his new Turtwig! The battle takes an unexpected turn when Turtwig disobeys Ash's orders.

media.title: Like It or Lup It
media.description: It's a rough day for hero and villain alike, as Dawn's Piplup struggles to perfect a move for the upcoming Pokémon Contest and Team Rocket struggles to find something to eat.

media.title: Gymbaliar
media.description: There's a new Gym in Sinnoh, and Team Rocket is in charge!

media.title: Setting the World on its Buneary
media.description: When Dawn wakes up to a bad hair day, there's only one solution: have Piplup use Bubblebeam to fix her hair!

media.title: Not On My Watch Ya Don't
media.description: Dawn's first Pokémon Contest is just days away, and in order to prepare, she's searching Jubilife City for a Pokétch—a handy accessory that looks like a watch but has multiple useful functions.

media.title: Mounting a Coordinator Assault
media.description: Dawn's mother Johanna has sent her a special outfit to wear for her first Pokémon Contest, which is just a day away!

media.title: Arrival of a Rival
media.description: The battles are about to begin in the Jubelife Pokémon Contest, and in the running are Dawn, Ash, Jessie (disguised as Jessilina), and a Coordinator named Zoey.

media.title: A Staravia Is Born
media.description: Ash is traveling through the forest on his way to Oreburgh City, where he hopes to earn his first Gym Badge in Sinnoh.

media.title: Leave It to Brocko!
media.description: On the way to Oreburgh, Ash and his friends see Nurse Joy trying to help an injured Nuzleaf. Nuzleaf is too upset to accept her help, so Brock steps in to calm Nuzleaf down.

media.title: Shapes of Things to Come
media.description: Ash and his friends have reached Oreburgh City, where Ash will try to earn his first Sinnoh Gym Badge. But Paul has beaten him to the Oreburgh Gym, and he'll battle Gym Leader Roark first—if Roark ever shows up!

media.title: A Gruff Act to Follow
media.description: Ash is in the middle of strategizing for his match when he finds out that Paul gave away his Azumarill because it wasn't tough enough.

media.title: Wild in the Streets
media.description: Dawn tries to convince Ash to send home for Pokémon that are strong against Rock Types, but Ash is persistent on using the ones he currently has.

media.title: O'er the Rampardos We Watched
media.description: Ash may have lost his battle at the Oreburgh Gym, but he wants a rematch and he's down at the Oreburgh mine to train hard for round two.

media.title: Twice Smitten, Once Shy
media.description: When Dawn comes across a wild Pachirisu, it's so cute that she just has to catch it!

media.title: Mutiny in the Bounty
media.description: On the way to Floaroma Town, our heroes see a Salamence-riding woman steal a Gardevoir from a Trainer named Maria. Ash and Pikachu come to the rescue, but the mystery woman sends out a Drapion and swipes Pikachu!

media.title: Ya See We Want an Evolution
media.description: As Team Rocket trudges through Sinnoh, they run into the Magikarp Salesman who's tricked them so many times before.

media.title: Borrowing on Bad Faith
media.description: When Ash and his friends pass a village that's holding an informal Pokémon Contest where the prize is a year's supply of fruit, Dawn is eager to enter.

media.title: Faced with Steelix Determination
media.description: As our Heroes their journey toward Floaroma Town and Dawn’s next Pokemon Contest, they come across a village of Bidoof whose safety is threatened by a rampaging Steelix.

media.title: Cooking Up a Sweet Story
media.description: Abigail takes Pikachu into the forest, where it uses Thunderbolt to zap berries and give them a delicious roasted flavor. Team Rocket notices this unusual electrical activity and tries to seize Pikachu.

media.title: Oh Do You Know the Poffin Plan
media.description: Dawn and Ash have reached Floaroma Town, the site of Dawn's next Pokémon Contest as well as a Poffin cooking class!

media.title: Getting the Pre-Contest Titters
media.description: With time running out before the start of the Floaroma Town Pokémon Contest, Dawn and Pachirisu are getting in as much training as they can.

media.title: Settling a Not-So-Old Score
media.description: The Floaroma Town Contest has just started, and Dawn's already in trouble! Pachirisu gets spooked before Dawn can even start their appeal, and only Dawn's quick thinking and a Poffin treat can calm it down.

media.title: Drifloon on the Wind
media.description: On the way to Eterna City, our heroes visit a Pokémon Center where they meet young Paige and her big sister Marnie, the daughters of the local Nurse Joy!

media.title: The Champ Twins
media.description: Ash and his friends have come across a newsworthy diversion: two notorious Pokémon Trainers who've won 16 battles in a row, attracting the attention of Rhonda the reporter and her Sinnoh Now news team.

media.title: Some Enchanted Sweetening
media.description: Ash and his friends find a tree full of delicious honey, the scent of which has attracted several Pokémon, including Ash's Aipom and a wild Burmy. The Burmy has also attracted the attention of a Trainer, Cheryl.

media.title: The Grass-type Is Always Greener
media.description: Deep in Eterna Forest, Ash and his friends have joined Cheryl the treasure hunter on her quest to find Enchanted Honey.

media.title: An Angry Combeenation
media.description: After several adventures, Ash, his friends, and Cheryl the treasure hunter are finally closing in on the elusive Amber Castle.

media.title: All Dressed Up With Somewhere to Go
media.description: What could convince our heroes to take a time-out from their journey to Eterna City? A Pokémon Dress-Up Contest where Pokémon try to imitate other Pokémon!

media.title: Buizel Your Way Out of This
media.description: On the way to Eterna City, our heroes go fishing in hopes of catching a powerful Buizel that's been spotted in a nearby river.

media.title: An Elite Meet and Greet
media.description: Dawn and Ash are hoping a friendly battle with Turtwig will help Dawn's new Buizel warm up to its new companions. But Buizel wants to play rough, and it won't even listen to Dawn's commands!

media.title: A Secret Sphere of Influence
media.description: Ash and his friends are in Eterna City for Ash's next Gym battle, but first they have to help solve a heist at the Eterna Historical Museum!

media.title: The Grass Menagerie
media.description: The time has come for Ash's Eterna Gym Battle with Gym Leader Gardenia, who's a Grass-type Pokémon expert. The battle will be 3-on-3, starting with Ash's Turtwig against Gardenia's Cherubi.

media.title: One Big Happiny Family
media.description: Ash and his friends are taking the Cyling Road toward Hearthome City, but when the weather turns bad and Brock's Pokémon Egg is about to hatch, they quickly take refuge at the nearest Pokémon Center.

media.title: Steamboat Willies
media.description: On the way to Hearthome City, Ash and his friends spot a sightseeing steamboat and decide to take a ride.

media.title: Top-Down Training
media.description: When word gets out that Champion League Master Cynthia is in town, our heroes can't resist a chance to meet her in person. But Paul is also in town, and he can't resist challenging Cynthia to a battle!

media.title: A Stand-Up Sit-Down
media.description: Dawn's latest training session is interrupted by a Glameow and Misdreavus that seem to be asking for help, and it's a safe bet that those Pokémon must belong to Zoey!

media.title: The Electrike Company
media.description: On a sunny day in Sinnoh, Ash is literally hit by a bolt out of the blue—an Electrike is practicing its Electric-type moves nearby, but it accidentally zapped Ash instead of its target!

media.title: Malice in Wonderland
media.description: Brock is surrounded by adoring Nurse Joys and Officer Jennys, Ash is invited to a tournament of the world's greatest Trainers, and Dawn is asked to compete in a Contest of the world's best Coordinators!

media.title: Mass Hip-Po-Sis
media.description: Ash's Turtwig brings everyone's attention to a young Hippopotas that's stranded on the ledge of a cliff. Ash hauls the Hippopotas to safety, and it insists on following him.

media.title: Ill-Will Hunting
media.description: Near Mr. Coronet, Ash and his friends come across Pokémon Hunter J's goons trying to snag a group of wild Shieldon. Ash is about to come to their rescue, but his old friend and rival Gary gets there first with his Electivire.

media.title: A Maze-ing Race
media.description: Dawn needs to turn in her coupon for a new Pokétch application, but she has to do it at the Pokémon Center on the far side of the forest, and time is running out!

media.title: Sandshrew's Locker
media.description: On the way to Hearthome City, Ash and his friends are approached by Mira, a friendly girl who offers them a shortcut. All they have to do is use her Abra to teleport there!

media.title: Dawn’s Early Night!
media.description: The moment of the Hearthome City Pokemon Contest has finally arrived, and Dawn finds herself competing along with Zoey, Nando, and Jessilina: Jessie in disguise.

media.title: Tag! We're It
media.description: Dawn is still feeling a little blue after her early exit from the Hearthome Pokémon Contest, so her friends convince her to compete in a tag battle tournament along with Ash and Brock.

media.title: Glory Blaze
media.description: The good news for Ash and his friends is that they've entered a tag battle tournament in Hearthome City and everyone made it past the first round. The bad news? Paul is Ash's partner and the two of them just can't get along.

media.title: Smells Like Team Spirit
media.description: After a strange victory in the second round of Hearthome City's tag battle tournament, Paul has abandoned his Chimchar and Ash wants Chimchar to join his team instead.

title: Pokémon: DP Battle Dimension
description: Ash, Pikachu, and their friends continue their adventure in the Sinnoh region as Pokémon: DP Battle Dimension arrives on Pokémon TV!

media.title: Tears for Fears
media.description: As our heroes head towards Veilstone City, Ash's new Chimchar struggles to adapt to its new surroundings.

media.title: Once There Were Greenfields
media.description: Ash and his friends run into Gardenia, the Eterna Gym Leader, in the middle of her travels through Sinnoh.

media.title: Throwing the Track Switch
media.description: Ash has Chimchar and Aipom battle each other to train for his upcoming Gym battle. But Buizel is distracted by the battle between Chimchar and Aipom.

media.title: The Keystone Pops
media.description: Aipom and Buizel are battling in a field when Aipom deflects Buizel's Sonic Boom into an old stone tower, knocking it down.

media.title: Bibarel Gnaws Best
media.description: On the way to Solaceon Town, our heroes reach a river with an unfinished bridge. Brock immediately falls for Isis, the stonecutter working on the bridge.

media.title: Nosing 'Round the Mountain
media.description: On Mt. Coronet, Ash and Turtwig are battling Alan, an energetic Trainer with a Nosepass. The only place Nosepass can evolve into Probopass is Mt. Coronet, so Alan is eager to have all the battles he can.

media.title: Luxray Vision
media.description: Hoping to find a place to stay for the night, our heroes visit an imposing manor. Instead, they're almost mistaken for thieves by Marble, a self-proclaimed Super-Duper Ace Detective.

media.title: Journey to the Unown
media.description: Deep in training for the Solaceon Contest, Dawn shows off Aipom's latest Contest move and discovers that Aipom has actually learned a new move: Double Hit!

media.title: Team Shocker
media.description: The Solaceon Contest is about to start, and Dawn is eager to show off her Ambipom's spectacular Swift move.

media.title: Tanks for the Memories
media.description: Brock leads his friends to the Mountain Hut Maid Café, where waitresses Spring, Summer, and Autumn serve up fresh Miltank milk.

media.title: Hot Springing a Leak
media.description: When it's late and there's no Pokémon Center nearby, Dawn comes up with the solution: a visit to a nearby hot spring hotel, owned by the parents of her old friend Leona!

media.title: Riding the Winds of Change
media.description: As Ash and his friends pass through a city, a Gliscor and a group of Gligar swarm them and gobble up all their lunch. What's more, Paul is also in town with his Murkrow—it looks like he's after Gliscor!

media.title: Sleight of Sand
media.description: There's still a desert to cross before Ash can reach Veilstone City and the next Gym, but our heroes decide to let their Pokémon out to play in the sand.

media.title: Lost Leader Strategy
media.description: Just as they reach Veilstone City, Ash and his friends spot a nearby commotion and track it down to the source: Gym Leader Maylene and her Lucario, locked in an intense sparring session!

media.title: Crossing the Battle Line
media.description: Dawn has challenged Maylene, the Veilstone Gym Leader, to a battle that's scheduled for the next day. This gives both Dawn and Ash time to train.

media.title: A Triple Fighting Chance
media.description: Dawn's Veilstone Gym challenge has restored Gym Leader Maylene's confidence, so Maylene is now ready to accept Ash's own Gym challenge.

media.title: Enter Galactic
media.description: Before Ash and his friends leave Veilstone City, Paul's brother Reggie shows him the city's most famous sight: a field full of ancient meteorites that are considered the guardians of the city.

media.title: The Bells Are Singing
media.description: It's another day on the road for our heroes: Ash and Gligar practice, while Dawn and Buneary study the latest Poké Chic fashion trends.

media.title: Crossing Paths
media.description: Dazzled by dreams of success, Jessie and Dustox train on the shores of a beautiful mountain lake. Jessie's Dustox is then distracted by an unfamiliar Dustox.

media.title: Pika and Goliath
media.description: Before he can get to Pastoria City, Ash has to battle a slang-talking Trainer named Sho. Sho wants to collect a Pikachu evolution set and he already has Raichu and Pichu, so he has his eye on Ash's Pikachu.

media.title: Our Cup Runneth Over
media.description: Wallace, a Coordinator star and former Gym Leader, is bringing his Wallace Cup event to the shores of Sinnohs Lake Valor.

media.title: A Full Course Tag Battle
media.description: May has arrived at Lake Valor to see her old friends and compete in the Wallace Cup. She's brought presents for everyone and a new Pokémon, Glaceon—it's the new Evolution of her trusty Eevee.

media.title: Staging a Heroes' Welcome
media.description: The day before the Wallace Cup, Zoey shows up at Lake Valor for the competition.

media.title: Pruning a Passel of Pals
media.description: With Dawn and her friends safely past the appeals round of the Wallace Cup, the girls enjoy an opportunity to sit back and chat while Ash, who can't sleep, decides to take a walk near Lake Valor.

media.title: Strategy With a Smile
media.description: It's the semifinal round of the Wallace Cup and Dawn's Piplup is battling hard against Kyle's Crawdaunt.

media.title: The Thief That Keeps On Thieving
media.description: On the way to Pastoria City, Ash and his friends meet Tyler and his Piplup, Pippy. The pair is hot on the trail of a Yanma.

media.title: Chim-Charred
media.description: While Ash's Pokémon train for the upcoming Pastoria Gym battle, Gligar is blown away by a sudden gust of wind. Gligar lands on Team Rocket's balloon—accidentally ripping a hole in it with its claws.

media.title: Cream of the Croagunk Crop!
media.description: Ash has reached the Pastoria City Gym, but there's no Gym battling today—the Gym Leader, Crasher Wake, is off to the Pastoria Great Marsh.

media.title: Pokémon Ranger and the Kidnapped Riolu! Part 1
media.description: In the middle of the night, chaos breaks loose in an isolated research center as research subject RX-1, a Riolu, escapes with the help of several men and a getaway truck.

media.title: Pokémon Ranger and the Kidnapped Riolu! Part 2
media.description: Pokémon Hunter J has trapped Ash and a kidnapped Riolu in the heart of a blazing forest fire so she can capture Riolu for her client—and Ash is unable to stop her from seizing Riolu and flying away!

media.title: A Crasher Course in Power!
media.description: It's the day after Pastoria City's Croagunk Festival—and while Team Rocket may have time to enjoy a leisurely marsh mud bath, Ash and his Pokémon must train for their Pastoria Gym battle.

media.title: Hungry for the Good Life!
media.description: Ash and his friends are saved from a sudden rainstorm when Monica, a housekeeper, invites them to stay at Mr. Backlot's mansion. Old Mr. Backlot is a wealthy man who's turned the area into a Trophy Garden for his Pokémon.

media.title: Fighting Fear With Fear
media.description: As Ash heads back to Hearthome City for his long-delayed Gym battle, he's concerned about his own Gligar's battle woes. Even though Ash gives Gligar lots of special training, it just can't get its act together.

media.title: Arriving in Style
media.description: Ash and his friends have returned to Hearthome City for Ash's Gym Battle, but Gym Leader Fantina is still out of town.

media.title: The Psyduck Stops Here!
media.description: Our heroes are on the path to Celestic Town, but the road runs through a narrow pass that's blocked by three irritable Psyduck. If Ash and his friends take a detour, they'll miss the Celestic Town Contest.

media.title: Camping It Up!
media.description: Ash and his friends are just in time for the Pokémon Summer Academy at Professor Rowan's research facility on Mt. Coronet, where young Trainers have gathered to make new friends and learn about Pokémon.

media.title: Up Close and Personable
media.description: It's the third day of Professor Rowan's Pokémon Summer Academy, and he's sent the campers to observe Water-type Pokémon living in a nearby lake.

media.title: Ghoul Daze
media.description: On the fifth day of the Pokémon Summer Academy, Professor Rowan has a special assignment for his campers: they'll each team up with a partner and go to the Summit Ruins at night.

media.title: One Team, Two Team, Red Team, Blue Team!
media.description: The Pokémon Summer Academy is almost over, but there's one more event left: the Pokémon Triathlon!

media.title: A Lean Mean Team Rocket Machine!
media.description: Dawn and Piplup are hard at work on a new BubbleBeam combination, but Piplup works so hard that it passes out from exhaustion! Dawn and the gang rush Piplup to a Pokémon Center for some much-needed rest.

media.title: Playing the Leveling Field
media.description: Dawn and her friends are passing through a town on their way to the Celestic Contest when they see Zoey in the middle of a tough battle with a well-dressed Coordinator.

media.title: Doc Brock
media.description: On the way to Celestic Town, Ash and his friends are camped at a mountain cabin. While Dawn trains and Ash snoozes, Brock goes down the mountain to visit a pharmacy.

media.title: Battling the Generation Gap
media.description: Dawn heads to the Celestic Town Contest, only to find that Lila is among the competition! Lila's making her big comeback, and she puts on a great show with her Cherrim.

media.title: Losing Its Lustrous!
media.description: Team Galactic has just stolen the Adamant Orb from a transport plane headed to Celestic Town, and their next target could be the Lustrous Orb stored in the town's research center.

media.title: A Double Team Turnover
media.description: Team Galactic Commanders Saturn and Mars have cornered Cynthia, her grandmother Carolina, the business mogul Cyrus, Officer Jenny's team, and our heroes inside the Celestic Town research center.

media.title: If the Scarf Fits, Wear It
media.description: On the way to Solaceon Town, Ash and his friends hear that the local "Scarf Monster" has made the tabloid news. Ash is skeptical, even though he and his friends see a shadow in the forest that looks much like the rumored monster itself.

media.title: A Trainer and Child Reunion
media.description: Ash and his friends enter a small town where all the girls are lined up to watch Aaron, one of the Elite Four, conduct a public training session.

media.title: Aiding the Enemy
media.description: Ash and his friends run into a Pokémon Center to watch a big battle on the TV: Champion Cynthia defeating Elite Four Aaron!

media.title: Barry's Busting Out All Over
media.description: As Ash enters the Hearthome Gym for his Gym Challenge, he collides with a blond Trainer in a hurry! The Trainer races off down the street, leaving his badge case behind.

media.title: Shield With a Twist
media.description: Ash is ready to battle Hearthome Gym Leader Fantina for the second time, with both his pride and the Relic Badge at stake.

media.title: Jumping Rocket Ship
media.description: Barry joins Ash and the gang as they take a blimp to Canalave City. As soon as they disembark, Team Rocket—disguised as photographers—offers to take a commemorative picture of everyone and their Pokémon.

media.title: Sleepless in Pre-Battle
media.description: Ash arrives at the Canalave Gym, only to hear bad news: the Gym Leader is away on Iron Island, and the locals are all sleep-deprived due to horrible nightmares!

title: Pokémon: DP Galactic Battles
description: Ash and friends find adventure in the Sinnoh region, but Team Galactic is ready to strike in Pokémon: DP Galactic Battles, now on Pokémon TV!

media.title: Get Your Rotom Running
media.description: On a tip from Professor Rowan, Ash and Dawn head for Canalave City's Old Chateau to sample its famous delicacy, the Old Gateau.

media.title: A Breed Stampede
media.description: After hearing that her rivals Kenny and Nando have scored new Contest victories, Dawn is eager to train her newly-evolved Piloswine for their next competition.

media.title: Ancient Family Matters
media.description: Ash arrives at the Canalave Gym, ready for a battle, but there's yet another snag: Gym Leader Byron's son is in town, and that son is Roark, the Oreburgh Gym Leader!

media.title: Dealing With Defensive Types
media.description: With Oreburgh Gym Leader Roark as referee, Ash starts his 3-on-3 Gym battle against Byron, Canalave's fossil-loving Gym Leader.

media.title: Leading a Stray
media.description: A Wailord blockage has trapped the boats in Canalave's harbor, and that means Dawn can't take a ferry to her next Contest. There's nothing to do but sit down for lunch, but a wild Luxio and its Pokémon accomplices steal the food!

media.title: Steeling Peace of Mind
media.description: On Iron Island, Ash's rival Barry is training with his Empoleon and Heracross when Empoleon suddenly turns on its Trainer.

media.title: Saving the World from Ruins!
media.description: Team Galactic has taken over the Iron Island ruins, where their Spear Key has unleashed a strange energy from the ruins.

media.title: Cheers on Castaways Isle!
media.description: Pikachu and Piplup ran into Team Rocket, who promptly kidnapped the two Pokémon and took off in their Magikarp submarine!

media.title: Hold the Phione!
media.description: Dawn, Ash, and Brock arrive in Chocovine Town to find everyone in a festive mood. It's not the upcoming Contest that has everyone excited—it's the annual visit of the Phione!

media.title: Another One Gabites the Dust!
media.description: Dawn and Pachirisu are practicing for the Chocovine Contest, just a day away. Pachirisu's reward for hard work is a delicious Poffin treat, but Dawn's Mamoswine and another Coordinator's Gabite deny Pachirisu even a single bite of Poffin.

media.title: Stealing the Conversation!
media.description: As our heroes are getting ready to head for Snowpoint City, Team Rocket makes a sudden grab for Ash's Pikachu.

media.title: The Drifting Snorunt!
media.description: Team Rocket is lost in a blizzard when a Froslass comes to their rescue. Our heroes are stranded in that same blizzard, trying to reach Snowpoint City, when Froslass invites them into a warm, cozy cabin.

media.title: Noodles! Roamin' Off!
media.description: When Team Rocket sits down for a delicious lunch at a noodle shop, the shop's owner asks to speak to them.

media.title: Pursuing a Lofty Goal!
media.description: There's a PokéRinger competition today in the windy town of Squallville, and James—in disguise—is using Jessie's Yanmega for a practice match.

media.title: Trials and Adulations!
media.description: As our heroes travel through the forest, Dawn stops at a spring by a river to refill her water bottle. A wild Aggron suddenly attacks her, and she falls into the river.

media.title: The Lonely Snover!
media.description: In the middle of a practice battle between Grotle and Chimchar, Ash and his friends are frozen solid by an icy blast from an unseen Pokémon.

media.title: Stopped in the Name of Love!
media.description: When Dawn and Ash reach Sandalstraw Town, they meet two familiar friends: Kenny and Barry! Kenny plans to enter the Sandalstraw Contest, while Barry is training for the upcoming Pokémon Ping-Pong competition.

media.title: Old Rivals, New Tricks!
media.description: Dawn plans to use some new Pokémon Ping-Pong tricks in the Sandalstraw Contest, where she hopes to earn her fifth ribbon.

media.title: To Thine Own Pokémon Be True!
media.description: Ash, Dawn, and Ash’s rival Barry are all competitors in Sandalstraw Town’s Pokémon ping-pong tournament, where Trainers form doubles teams with their Pokémon.

media.title: Battling a Cute Drama!
media.description: Ash and his friends have reached Shelter Town, a snow-covered town near Snowpoint City, and they’re taking a break at the Pokémon Center.

media.title: Classroom Training!
media.description: Zoey welcomes our heroes to her hometown, Snowpoint City, the site of Ash’s next Gym battle.

media.title: Sliding Into Seventh
media.description: The time has come for Ash to challenge Candice, the Snowpoint Gym Leader, for his seventh Gym Badge. Zoey joins Dawn and Brock in the spectator seats while Mr. Honcho from the Pokémon Trainer School referees this four-on-four battle.

media.title: A Pyramiding Rage!
